intro: Spatularia brunoniana, commonly known as the broad-leafed spathulate, is a species of flowering plant in the family Poaceae. It is characterized by its wide, flat leaves that resemble a spatula, giving it its common name. The plant typically grows in moist, often swampy environments, preferring wetlands and marshy areas. It produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are clustered in spikes, typical of grasses. Spatularia brunoniana is often found in temperate regions and is adapted to thrive in waterlogged soils.
